intro: Astragalus heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. Astragalus heldreichii is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
